Yes, there are several precautions you can take to protect yourself from dangerous animals and insects when traveling in Costa Rica:

1. Wear appropriate clothing and footwear – When traveling in areas where dangerous animals or insects are present, it is important to wear long-sleeved shirts, long pants, and closed-toe shoes to protect your skin.

2. Use insect repellent – Apply insect repellent containing DEET, picaridin, or lemon eucalyptus oil to exposed skin to protect against mosquito bites and other insect bites.

3. Stay on designated paths – Avoid walking off-trail in areas where snakes or other dangerous animals may be present.

4. Don't approach wild animals – Do not attempt to touch or feed wild animals in Costa Rica, as this can provoke them and lead to an attack.

5. Be cautious near bodies of water – When swimming or boating in Costa Rica's rivers and ocean, be aware of potential dangers such as crocodiles and sharks.

6. Seek medical attention if bitten or stung – If you are bitten or stung by an animal or insect, seek medical attention immediately. Time is critical in treating venomous snake bites and other serious injuries.
